subject: Re: [junit] JFCUnit, GUI testing with JUnit... Re: Best Practice for Tests ?
msgSnippet: ... I think the lesson here is that testing a GUI framework has completely different needs from testing a GUI application. Having tried to use java.awt.Robot
messageBody:
--- David Herron <davidh@...> wrote:
> I just downloaded and looked at their code. They have a fatal, from
> my perspective, flaw. Namely, to generate events against the
> components they create a Java level event and post it to the event
> queue like so:

I think the lesson here is that testing a GUI framework has completely
different needs from testing a GUI application. Having tried to use
java.awt.Robot to test an application, I prefer the style of jfcunit.

One man's fatal flaw is another man's feature.

Regards,

Rob
